result.markdown:
--- title: "My First Date with Quarto" author: "Dr. Kam Tin Seong" date: "September 15, 2025" date-modified: "last-modified" format: docx: theme: default toc: true number-sections: true execute: eval: true echo: true warning: false freeze: true editor: visual --- ## Getting Started Code chunk below perform the following tasks: - loading **knitr**, **DT**, and **tidyverse** family of r packages onto R environment by using `p_load()` of **pacman** package. - importing *Exam_data.csv* into R and save it as a tibble data frame by using `read_csv()` of **readr** package. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(tidyverse, knitr, DT) exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv") ``` ::: ## Hello Plot Code chunk below is used to plot a histogram of Maths score by using functions of **ggplot2** package. ::: {style="font-size: 1.20em"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) + geom_histogram(bins = 10, boundary = 100, color = "black", fill = "pink") + ggtitle("Distribution of Maths Scores") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on1_files/figure-docx/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png) ::: ::: ::: ### Dual columns slide In this sub-sections, `columns` function of Quarto is used to split the display area into two equal parts. :::::: columns :::: {.column width="50%"} The code chunk. ::: {style="font-size: 1.00em"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) + geom_histogram(bins = 10, boundary = 100, color = "black", fill = "light blue") + ggtitle("Distribution of Maths Scores") ``` ::: ::: :::: ::: {.column width="50%"} The plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Hands-on1_files/figure-docx/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png) ::: ::: ::: :::::: ## Adding Table ### Static html table This slide shows an example of displaying a professional looking table on Quarto using `kable()` of **knitr** package. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
ID CLASS GENDER RACE ENGLISH MATHS SCIENCE
Student321 3I Male Malay 21 9 15
Student305 3I Female Malay 24 22 16
Student289 3H Male Chinese 26 16 16
Student227 3F Male Chinese 27 77 31
Student318 3I Male Malay 27 11 25
Student306 3I Female Malay 31 16 16
````` ::: ::: ### Interactive table This slide shows an example of displaying a professional looking table on Quarto using `datatable()` of **DT** package. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} datatable(data = exam_data, options = list( scrollY = "400px", scrollX = TRUE, scrollCollapse = TRUE, paging = FALSE), width = "100%") ``` :::
